en.title:
Project Bloom
<size=30>A Quest for Home</size>
en.new_house: A new house is available! Deploy it to progress.
en.intro_1_0: They appear to be frog-like. Let me put on my frog suit to communicate with these peculiar creatures!
en.intro_2_0: That’s better! Let’s see if they are of any threat…
en.intro_3_0: It looks like they have been exiled from their planet, and are looking for a new home.
en.intro_3_1: Well, we can’t just let them hang about in space. Besides, how often are we visited by sentient aliens from outer space?
en.intro_4_0: They are expressing their gratitude, and are ready to cooperate in exchange for their refuge.
en.intro_4_1: Well, why not? Let’s give these hapless frogs some proper homes to settle in. There’s still plenty of room here on Earth.
en.intro_4_2: Now commencing operation: Project Bloom – A quest for home!
en.overworld_1_intro_0: This is the map of Earth. The frogs are very particular with their choice of habitat.
en.overworld_1_intro_1: We’ll need to determine where to place the frogs by looking at their criteria.
en.overworld_1_criteria_0: In this case, we need to find a place where it’s fairly warm and humid.
en.overworld_1_hud_0: On the lefthand side of the map are the latitude values. This is the angular distance relative to the earth’s equator (middle of the map).
en.overworld_1_hud_1: Now let’s view the temperature readings of Earth.
en.overworld_1_temp_0: As you can see, the temperature is consistently hot starting from the equator, and gets colder further north or south.
en.overworld_1_humid_0: Next is the humidity readings of Earth. The percentage tells us how much water vapor is present on air.
en.overworld_1_humid_1: Notice how humidity tends to be higher in large forest and jungle areas, such as the Amazon rainforest.
en.overworld_1_hotspot_0: Now go ahead and find a place for the frogs to land. Simply click around the map to find the spot.
en.overworld_1_hotspot_1: Remember to make use of the temperature and humidity reading.
en.overworld_1_hotspot_2: Hint: we are looking for a temperate climate, perhaps somewhere in North America...
en.overworld_1_analyze_0: Looks like the temperature is too low. We will need to change the time of the year to land on this spot.
en.overworld_1_analyze_1: Since the earth rotate at a slightly tilted axis around the sun, the atmosphere can change throughout the year.
en.overworld_1_analyze_2: Why don’t we adjust the time by selecting a different season.
en.overworld_1_investigate_0: Now you just need to pick a particular location on the land for the frogs.
en.overworld_1_investigate_1: When the majority of the frogs approve, we can finally launch the expedition!
